title: Sri Lanka biz chamber ‘gravely concerned’ over emergency
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Ceylon Chamber of Commerce has said it is gravely concerned over the negative fallout of declaring an emergency to stop protests and banning social media.

“The adverse coverage Sri Lanka is getting on international media, particularly on the imposition of a state of emergency can cause serious damage at a time when the tourism sector is just beginning to stage a recovery,” the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce said.
A ban on social media was also hurting business, e-commerce, exports, tourism and trade, the chamber said.
Sri Lanka’s telecom operators said it had banned social media on the request of the regulator.
